result.execSummary:
The defendant Charlene Darlene Gordon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Complete AODA and After Care Program. Complete any other programming as recommended by DOC. Maintain full-time employment or education.

records.addlTxt: Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.

Defendant Charlene Darlene Gordon in court, in custody with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties received the PSI, no objections. Court imposed 3 years 6 months prison, consisting of 1 year, 6 months confinement, 2 years extended supervision. Sentence stayed, defendant placed on 2 years probation, consecutive to present sentence. Conditions: $518 costs. Complete AODA and After Care Program. Complete any other programming as recommended by DOC. Maintain full-time employment or education.  Not eligible for Challenge Academy, but is for Substance Abuse Program.  No jail credit.
Probation Agent Dornfeld, writer of PSI, unable to attend Nov. 7th sentencing
